comments.body: Why having two ways of populating kwargs for infos that are in module.params that end up in params ? Also links the wsclient to the idea that there is a node_type or a relation_type in the params. This will probably not be the case if you extend skydive operations with bulk operations (and in my opinion you SHOULD extend it with bulk operations because the speed gain is too important to ignore).
by skydive bulk operations you meant to add the list of nodes and edges, if yes please check comment: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/53112#discussion_r263298422

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +164,168 @@        scheme = kwargs['scheme']
        self.result = dict(changed=False)
        if "node_type" in module.params:
            self.wsclient_object = WSClient("ansible-" + str(os.getpid()) + "-" + module.params['host'],
                                            "%s://%s/ws/publisher" % (scheme, kwargs["endpoint"]),

comments.body: You do your best to fuse nodes and edges in the same inject class. If you follow that route, I would rather prefer that you directly find a way to consume lists of nodes and edges. The expensive operation is opening a websocket, if you can share it for different operations the gain can be very high.

I understand your point, but I think we can add this as a new feature in the future releases. As there are some planned changes in Ansible `2.9` release and there will some work that needs to be done in skydive modules as well in `2.9` version and that time I can add support of adding the list of nodes and edges.

The simplest test that could be done (more or less the example in the documentation) fails. skydive_inject_protocol' object has no attribute 'connection_made'". You have decided to not extend WsClientDefaultProtocol but WSClient needs to implement the protocol interface for trollius. As expected the above exception is raised.
